result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie James Rathman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. If fine and costs on this case and case no. 16-TR-901 are not paid in full on or before 2/22/17, stay on jail time will be lifted.

Stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs on this case and case no. 16-TR-901 in full on or before 2/22/17, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs on this case and case no. 16-TR-901 in full on or before 2/22/17, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

Defendant Willie James Rathman in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Willie James Rathman in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Willie James Rathman in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises of pretrial offer from State that requires payment up front, requests status in about 45 days.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 10:15 am.
from Defense requesting phone appearance for 9/14 status conference. Per Court, approved.

Defendant Willie James Rathman in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress getting an attorney. Defendant wants more time, spoke to one who's too expensive and too far away. Court reviews right to Court-appointed Counsel. Defendant leaves to speak to PD, returns with Atty Greg Gerbers. Atty Gerbers has to do conflict check, enters not guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Willie James Rathman in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant requests additional time to get an attorney, does not qualify for PD.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.
from DA to Defendant advising of new court date
